preparation_steps: Test soil pH to 6.0-7.0 using digital meter 2-3 weeks before planting
Work 2-3 inches compost into top 8 inches soil when temperature reaches 50°F
Choose location with full sun receiving 6-8 hours direct sunlight daily
planting_steps: Start Radishes seeds indoors 6-8 weeks before 2025-05-10 at 70-75°F soil temperature
Sow seeds 0.5 inches deep with 1 inch spacing between plants
Transplant outdoors 2 weeks after 2025-05-10 when nighttime temperatures stay above 50°F
care_instructions: Water Radishes deeply 1-1.5 inches per week checking soil moisture 2 inches deep every 3 days
Apply 10-10-10 fertilizer at 2 tablespoons per plant every 3 weeks starting 2 weeks after transplant
Mulch with 2-3 inches organic matter keeping 6 inches away from plant stem
pest_management: Inspect Radishes weekly for common zone 4a-6a pests from May through September
Apply neem oil spray at 2 tablespoons per gallon water every 14 days if pests detected
Use floating row covers first 3 weeks after transplant to prevent early season pest damage
harvest_instructions: Begin harvesting Radishes approximately 25 days after transplant when fruits reach full size
Harvest in early morning 6-8 AM when temperatures below 75°F for best quality and flavor
Cut stems with clean sharp shears 1/4 inch above leaf node to encourage continued production
storage_tips: Store fresh Radishes at 55-60°F with 85% humidity for maximum 7-10 days after harvest
Blanch and freeze within 24 hours of harvest - maintains quality for 8-12 months in freezer
Preserve excess using canning or dehydrating methods appropriate for vegetable type

Harvest in early morning 6-8 AM when temperatures below 75°F for best quality and flavor

storage_tips: Store fresh Green Beans at 55-60°F with 85% humidity for maximum 7-10 days after harvest
Blanch and freeze within 24 hours of harvest - maintains quality for 8-12 months in freezer
Preserve excess using canning or dehydrating methods appropriate for vegetable type

plant_groupings.spacing_notes: Plant radishes in rows, about 1 inch apart. Plant green beans in rows, about 6 inches apart.

general_tips: In Moncton's cold climate, start radish seeds indoors 2-3 weeks before the last frost date to give them a head start.
Choose a location with full sun (at least 6 hours of direct sunlight) for your green beans, as they require warmth and light to grow.
Radishes are quick-growing and can be harvested in as little as 20 days. Make sure to sow seeds every 1-2 weeks for continuous harvests.
Green beans prefer well-draining soil with a pH between 6.0 and 7.0. Test your soil before planting to ensure it's suitable for green beans.
In Moncton's short growing season, use row covers or cold frames to extend the growing season for both radishes and green beans.
Radishes are sensitive to heat and can bolt (go to seed) if the temperature rises above 75°F. Keep them shaded during hot weather.
For a successful green bean harvest, provide support with trellises or cages as they grow, and keep the area around the plants weed-free.
